016package com.nickbenn.adventofcode.day06;
017
018import static com.nickbenn.adventofcode.view.Presentation.NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT;
019
020import java.util.Arrays;
021import java.util.List;
022
023/**
024 * Implements a solution to the day 6 problem, which requires finding the number of integers in the
025 * domain of a quadratic expression for which the expression has a positive value. The only
026 * distinction between parts 1 and 2 is the input data; in this implementation, this data is taken
027 * from a {@code long[][]} constructor parameter.
028 *
029 * @see <a href="https://adventofcode.com/2023/day/6">"Day 6: Wait For It"</a>.
030 */
031public class WaitForIt {
032
033  private static final long[][] separateRaces =
034      new long[][]{{46, 358}, {68, 1054}, {98, 1807}, {66, 1080}};
035  private static final long[][] joinedRaces = new long[][]{{46689866, 358105418071080L}};
036
037  private final List<long[]> raceTimesAndDistances;
038
039  /**
040   * Initializes this instance with specified pairs of time &amp; distance values. In each nested
041   * array, the first element is the time limit for a race, while the second is the stated record
042   * distance for the race.
043   *
044   * @param raceTimesAndDistances Paired time &amp; distance values.
045   */
046  public WaitForIt(long[][] raceTimesAndDistances) {
047    this.raceTimesAndDistances = Arrays.stream(raceTimesAndDistances).toList();
048  }
049
050  /**
051   * For each of parts 1 and 2, creates an instance of {@link WaitForIt} with the relevant data,
052   * invokes the {@link #countWinningCombinations()}, and prints the result.
053   *
054   * @param args Command-line arguments (currently ignored).
055   */
056  public static void main(String[] args) {
057    System.out.printf(NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT, 1,
058        new WaitForIt(separateRaces).countWinningCombinations());
059    System.out.printf(NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT, 2,
060        new WaitForIt(joinedRaces).countWinningCombinations());
061  }
062
063  /**
064   * Counts the number of integral values of <em>x</em> in each race, for which the inequality
065   * <em>x</em>(<em>T - x</em>) &gt; <em>D</em> holds (where <em>T</em> is the time limit for the
066   * race, and <em>D</em> is the stated distance record), then computes and returns the product of
067   * these counts.
068   * <p>Implementation notes: Rather than iterating across the range 0..<em>T</em> and testing the
069   * above inequality for each value, the quadratic formula is used to identify the endpoints of the
070   * range of values for which the inequality holds in each race.</p>
071   */
072  public long countWinningCombinations() {
073    return raceTimesAndDistances
074        .stream()
075        .mapToLong((pair) -> countWins(pair[0], pair[1]))
076        .reduce(1, (a, b) -> a * b);
077  }
078
079  private long countWins(long time, long distanceRecord) {
080    long count = 0;
081    long discriminantSquared = time * time - 4 * distanceRecord;
082    if (discriminantSquared >= 0) {
083      double discriminant = Math.sqrt(discriminantSquared);
084      long lowerRoot = (long) Math.floor((time - discriminant) / 2.0) + 1;
085      long upperRoot = (long) Math.ceil((time + discriminant) / 2.0) - 1;
086      count = upperRoot - lowerRoot + 1;
087    }
088    return count;
089  }
090
091}
